p: For non-medical settings, the CDC does not recommend the usage of gloves for containing the spread of COVID-19, unless caring for an infected family member where there is a risk of being exposed to bodily fluids. While the gloves themselves have been proven to be effective, many individuals without medical training are far less likely to frequently replace them, and thus risk contaminating others with dirty gloves. Instead, the CDC recommends frequent use of hand sanitizer containing 60% or more alcohol, or frequent handwashing with soap and water for at least 30 s, to ensure any microorganisms are cleaned off [ 74].
